Phoenix KMM Testnet
Background watcher Alerts you if you need to start the app. Should be high priority. Accept incoming payment Pops up when someone sends you a payment and you need to accept it manually. Phoenix running in background Notifies you that Phoenix is running in background. This happens when someone is sending you money and the app is not already started.
Creating your wallet… Failed to write wallet keys.\nReason: %1$s
Restore my wallet Do not import a seed that was NOT created by this application.\n\nAlso, make sure you are not already running another Phoenix wallet with the same seed. I understand. Next Your wallet\'s seed is a list of 12 English words Enter keywords from your seed. This is not a valid word. This seed is not valid.\nMake sure you entered the words\nin the correct order. Restoring your wallet… Import
Unlock to continue Device is not secure (code: %1$d)
Wallet is locked Unlock with PIN

Generating invoice… QR Code of the invoice Amount: Desc: Your wallet is empty. First incoming payment must be at least %1$s. Edit Share Show a Bitcoin address Deposit via LNURL
Payment requested Share this payment request with… Share…
Edit my invoice Amount (optional) Any amount Description (optional): Create invoice
Address Deposits will be converted to Lightning channels.\n\nTotal deposits must be at least %1$s.\nThe fee is%2$s%% (%3$s sat minimum).
Balance: Send all Amount is too large. Amount cannot be negative. This is not a valid amount. This amount exceeds your balance. Cannot pay more than %1$s. This amount is below the requested amount of %1$s. Send to Payment description Pay
Pay on-chain On-chain transactions are typically slower and best suited for large payments. Pay with Lightning Lightning payments are fast and best suited for small payments.
Min. %1$s for on-chain payments Max. %1$s for on-chain payments Total after fees exceeds your balance.\nThis payment cannot be sent. Prepare transaction Preparing transaction Amount Miner Fee Total What are those fees?
Payments to on-chain addresses require a swap and incur mining fees for the Bitcoin network. The fee rate used for the transaction is fixed by the swap service.
Reading scan… Manual input Paste data from clipboard Tap to grant camera permission Camera permission has been denied Scan a QR code containing a payment request, a Bitcoin address or a LNURL
This invoice is expired. This payment has already been paid. This payment does not use the same blockchain as your wallet. Failed to process this LNURL link. Make sure it is valid. The LNURL service returned an error. This type of LNURL is not supported yet! This data uses an unknown format and cannot be processed.
Fetching data from service…
Warning This invoice doesn\'t include an amount. This may be dangerous: malicious nodes may be able to steal your payment. To be safe, you should ask the payee to specify an amount in the payment request.\n\nAre you sure you want to pay this invoice? Confirm Cancel
Manual input Enter a Lightning invoice, LNURL, or Lightning address you want to send money to. Enter an invoice or a LN address
≈ %1$s !? BTC exchange rate unavailable Amount
Proceed Cancel just now N/A Copied to clipboard!
Open a link in a browser This field cannot be blank Please enter a valid amount This field must be an integer Must be at least %1$s Must be no more than %1$s
Go back Next Copy OK Save Confirm Cancel Close Connecting to peer… Connecting to electrum…
General Display Privacy & Security Recovery phrase Access control Advanced Fees Settings Payment channels Logs Electrum server Drain wallet Danger zone Tor About Payment options
Please start Phoenix A cheating attempt has been detected.
Phoenix needs network access The background watcher needs internet to function properly.
Phoenix is running in background Missed incoming payment A pending payment has been fulfilled Payment received App is locked Tap to start the app Channel creation requires manual approval Received %1$s (%2$s)
Accept incoming payment Tap to open the app
Drain my wallet Loading… Checking balance… Balance: %1$s (≈ %2$s) The wallet does not have any channels and cannot be drained. Send all funds to a Bitcoin wallet. All payments channels will be closed. Bitcoin address Enter a Bitcoin address here Drain my wallet This address uses a different blockchain This address uses unsupported features This address is not supported Are you sure you want to proceed? %1$d channel(s) have been closed. You can find the details in the home screen. Please wait…
Force-close channels No channels to close This screen allows you to unilaterally close your channels.\n\nThis is not a \"fix-everything\" magic button: it is here as a safety measure and should only be used in extreme scenarios. For example, if your peer (ACINQ) disappears permanently, preventing you from spending your money. In all other cases, if you experience issues with Phoenix you should contact support.\n\nForce closing channels will cost you money (to cover the on-chain fees) and will cause your funds to be locked for days.\n\nDo not uninstall the app until your channels are fully closed or you will lose money.\n\nDo not use this feature if you don\'t fully understand what it does. Funds will eventually be sent to: Force-close all my channels
Payment channels Node id: You don\'t have any channels yet.\n\nPayments channels are created when you receive a payment and a new channel is needed. This is done automatically. Share Channel id: Funding tx See funding transaction Close Channels data Share channel data
Retrieving channel data… Could not retrieve the details for this channel. Please try again later. Send Receive
Settings Send Receive
Create new wallet Restore my wallet
Loading… +%1$s incoming Incoming deposit Once the incoming payment is confirmed, Phoenix will use the funds to open a payment channel.\n\nThe fee is %1$s%% (%2$s sat minimum). Deposit below minimum Deposits must be at least %1$s. Please make additional deposits to use the funds inside Phoenix.\n\nOnce the minimum amount is reached, Phoenix will use the funds to open a payment channel.\n\nThe fee is %2$s%% (%3$s sat minimum).
FAQ You have not made any payments recently.\n\nUse the Receive and Send buttons at the bottom of this screen to get started! Recent payments Show all payments… Electrum certificate Connecting… Tor enabled
Thanks for using Phoenix. Please backup your wallet so that you don\'t lose your bitcoins. Backup my wallet Phoenix needs to be able to run in background from time to time. Make sure your device does not aggressively kill this app for battery savings. An update for this app is available. A critical update is available. The wallet may malfunction if not updated. Bitcoin mempool is full and fees are high. See how Phoenix is affected
Recovery phrase Display seed Unlocking seed… Could not unlock seed: %1$s Could not unlock seed, please try again. PIN is incorrect. The backup phrase, known as a seed, is a list of 12 english words. It allows you to recover full access to your funds if needed.\n\nOnly you alone possess this seed. Keep it private.\n\nDo not share this seed with anyone.\nBeware of phishing. The developers of Phoenix will never ask for your seed.\n\nDo not lose this seed.\nSave it somewhere safe (not on this phone). If you lose your seed and your phone, you\'ve lost your funds. BIP39 seed with standard BIP84 derivation path I have made a backup of my seed, for example on a piece of paper. KEEP THIS SEED SAFE.\nDO NOT SHARE.
Application logs View logs… View logs with… Share logs… Phoenix App logs Share Phoenix logs…
Payment details Loading payment details… There was an error when retrieving the details for this payment:\n\nCause:%1$s
Sent Pending… Failed. No money has been sent.
Not received yet. Waiting for confirmations requires %1$d confirmations Received
Desc. Add note You can attach a note to this payment. To Fees Miner fees Bitcoin network fees paid for on-chain transaction. Service fees In order to receive this payment, a new payment channel was opened. This is not always required. \Error No description This payment happened following a conflict in a channel.
Closing channel Donation Swap-out to %1$s On-chain deposit
Add a custom description to this payment Attach note Edit note Technical details
Recipient is not reachable, or does not have enough inbound liquidity. Payment rejected by the recipient.\nThis usually occurs when the invoice has already been paid or when it contains an expiration date, and you attempted to send a payment after the expiration. No route found with current fee setting. Try with higher fees. Edit my fee setting
Type of payment Standard outgoing Lightning payment Standard incoming Lightning payment Swap-in Bitcoin deposit Swap-out to Bitcoin address Closing channel Keysend (spontaneous payment) Deposit address Bitcoin address Transactions - #%1$s:
Id of the channel Closing address

Created at Completed at Elapsed %1$s ms
Amount requested Amount sent Amount received ≈ %1$s (now) ≈ %1$s (then)
Waiting for confirmation Waiting for peer Channel is closing Channel has been closed Up and running Synchronizing Peer is offline Shutdown
Application access
Your device does not support hardware backed user authentication. Your biometric hardware is not available. Please enroll a PIN/Schema/Fingerprint in Android first. An Android security update is required. Not supported by your version of Android. Too many attempts, try again later.
Unable to get cipher: %1$s Authentication failed.
Screen lock Lock access to the app with Android\'s screen lock/fingerprint
You can anonymously sign-in and authorize an action on: Legacy mode Tap here for more info How does it work? Phoenix authenticates with a key unique to %1$s. This unique key becomes your password for your account there. Privacy The service will not have access to your wallet whatsoever. They cannot see your balance, payments, or keys. Legacy mode Phoenix uses a non-standard scheme on this service to be compatible with older versions of the app. The associated account will not be portable to other wallets. Change scheme Sign-in Try again Signing-in to\n%1$s Authentication success. Authentication failure: Network error. Check your internet connection and try again. An unknown error occurred. Try again.
Compliant (recommended) Use the standard LNURL\'s specifications scheme. This is the recommended option, especially for new wallets. Legacy friendly Use a legacy scheme on some services to let you use accounts that were created with the old Phoenix Android app.
You can redeem funds from\n%1$s. Amount to receive Details Redeem Requesting funds… Request successfully sent to %1$s.\n\nIt may take some time before they send the funds. Please keep the app online in the meanwhile. Amount is invalid. Amount must be at least %1$s. Amount cannot exceed %1$s. Withdrawal has failed:
The service %1$s responded with an error:\n\n%2$s.\n\nContact their support if needed. The service %1$s returned an HTTP error (%2$s).\n\nContact their support if needed. The service %1$s returned a malformed message. Could not connect to service %1$s.
Served by Payment description Add optional comment You can attach a comment to the payment (max %1$d characters). It will be sent to the recipient. No comment Pay Requesting invoice… Checking invoice… Sending payment…
Amount must not be empty Amount must be at least %1$s Amount must be at most %1$s Amount exceeds your balance Invalid amount
Payment has failed. The invoice returned by %1$s does not use the same chain as your wallet. The invoice returned by %1$s has already been paid. The invoice returned by %1$s has an incorrect amount. The invoice returned by %1$s does not match the request details. The invoice returned by %1$s is malformed.
Display options Bitcoin unit Satoshi (sat) 1 sat is 0.00000001 btc Bit (bit) 1 bit is 0.000001 btc Milli-Bitcoin (mbtc) 1 mbtc is 0.001 btc Bitcoin (btc) Fiat currency Application theme Dark theme Light theme Follow system Onchain explorer Show balance in home Hiding balance helps against prying eyes
Electrum server To secure your payment channels Phoenix monitors the Bitcoin blockchain through Electrum servers.\n\nBy default, random servers are used. You can also configure Phoenix to connect only to your own server. Block height Tip timestamp Fee rate Master public key %1$s\n\nPath: %2$s %1$s sat/byte Server
Disconnected from Electrum Disconnected from %1$s Connecting to Electrum Connecting to %1$s Connected to %1$s
You are using a custom server This server provided an unknown certificate. Connection is rejected.
Use a custom server Server address (host:port) This address is invalid. Connect Checking certificate… Failed to connect:\n%1$s This address cannot be resolved. Untrusted certificate SHA1 Fingerprint SHA256 Fingerprint Issuer Subject Valid until Copy certificate Trust certificate
Add whitespace Delete last character
Tor Phoenix can use Tor to shield your IP from the other nodes in the Lightning Network and Electrum servers. This improves your privacy but makes the app slower. Checking preferences… Tor is enabled Connections to the Lightning network and Electrum servers will be protected. Are you sure you want to disable Tor? Are you sure you want to enable Tor? Note that for best result, it\'s recommended to start a new wallet as well. The Tor proxy is not started yet. The Tor proxy is shutdown.\nPlease wait and check your Internet connection. Starting Tor proxy… Tor is online Note that the Tor network is an open project running on donations. It can sometimes be very slow, which will affect the app\'s performances.
Connections status The app will not function correctly until all connections are established. Your device has no Internet connection. The app will not function properly.\n\nPlease check your device\'s setting. Internet Electrum Tor Peer Manage connection for %1$s Connecting… Connected Disconnected Bad certificate
About Phoenix About Phoenix is a Bitcoin wallet using the Lightning network for sending and receiving payments.\n\nIt is a free open source software, developed by ACINQ under the Apache 2.0 License. Safeguarding your key This wallet is self-custodial: you have sole custody of the wallet\'s 12-words seed key.\n\nThis key gives access to your money. Do not reveal it to anyone, and beware of phishing. Exchange rates Bitcoin/fiat exchange rates are retrieved from various third-party APIs:\n\n- Blockchain.info\n- powered by Coindesk.com\n- Coinbase.com\n- Bluelytics.com.ar\n- Yadio.io\n\nThose rates may not be accurate. Always check the actual Bitcoin amount before sending a payment. Phoenix version: %1$s Any questions? Check the FAQ Support Privacy Terms
Payment settings
Incoming payment description No description set… Default description Payment requests that you create will use this description. You can override it on a case-by-case basis. Enter a description
Incoming payment expiry Payment expiry Payment requests generated by your wallet are stale after this delay. Default value is 1 week.
1 week 2 weeks 3 weeks %1$s seconds
Maximum fee for outgoing Lightning payments %1$s + %2$s%% Override default fee for outgoing payments Base fee (satoshi) Enter a base fee in satoshi Proportional fee (%) Enter a proportional fee in % Enter a valid maximum fee setting Base fee must be at least %1$s. Base fee cannot exceed %1$s. Proportional fee must be at least %1$s%%. Proportional fee cannot exceed %1$s%%.
Fee for on-the-fly channel creation %1$s%% (%2$s sat minimum) On-the-fly channels This fee applies when you receive a payment over Lightning and a new channel needs to be created. See the FAQ for more information
LNURL authentication scheme
Congratulations! You are now using the new Phoenix version. Your channels are being migrated and will be ready soon.
Argentine Peso (blue market) Cuban Peso (free market) Lebanese Pound (black market)

No payments found.
Welcome! With Phoenix, sending and receiving bitcoins is easy and safe. Next
Bitcoin supercharged Phoenix uses payment channels to make Bitcoin fast and private. Next
Your key, your bitcoins Phoenix is self-custodial. You take control. You can restore your wallet at anytime using your secret key. Keep it safe! Get started
